definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: You can tell the very rich by their evening dress.
sentences.chinese: 你可從夜禮服認出那些極有錢的富人。

sentences.english: He has a distinctive goatee, so I can recognize him easily.
sentences.chinese: 他留着獨特的山羊鬍子，所以我很容易就認出他來了。

sentences.english: It shows real people, regardless of who can recognize them.
sentences.chinese: 不管誰能認出他們，真實的人物出現在裏面。

sentences.english: I recognized him as soon as I saw his back.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到後身，就認出是他。

sentences.english: Li recognized the voice of her boss.
sentences.chinese: 李萬枝認出是工廠領導的聲音。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the butcher recognized the dog as belonging to a neighbor of his.
sentences.chinese: 很幸運地，肉商辨認出’這隻狗是屬於他鄰居的。

sentences.english: Why is the man in black the thief?
sentences.chinese: 你知道包大人是如何辨認出小偷的嗎？

sentences.english: Monkey, seeing that the boy was actually a demon in disguise, told his master not to bother.
sentences.chinese: 悟空認出那是妖怪變的，叫師父少管閒事。

sentences.english: The face there, if you have seen him before, you will recognize as Yeats's.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，如果你見過他，你會認出這是葉芝。

sentences.english: I knew him for a Frenchman.
sentences.chinese: 我認出他是一名法國人。

sentences.english: He discerned that Howard was lying.
Peering out his door into the night, he recognized the face of a trusted neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 他開門窺望，夜色中認出是一位可靠的鄰居。
現在誰還能認出他來呢？

sentences.english: Her mind seemed to be wandering, and she didn't recognize me.
sentences.chinese: 她好象精神恍惚，沒認出我來。

sentences.english: The porters may be identified by their red caps.
sentences.chinese: 從他們戴的紅帽子就可以辨認出他們是行李搬運工。

definition: to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
